title: Sliders
description: Sliders allow users to make selections from a range of values.

contentChunks.htmlValue: There are two types of sliders: continuous and discrete.

contentChunks.altText: Diagram with continuous slider on left, discrete slider on right

contentChunks.htmlValue: Resources

TypeLinkStatus
DesignDesign kit (Figma)Available
M2 guideline â€“ SlidersAvailable
ImplementationMDC-AndroidAvailable
Jetpack ComposeAvailable
FlutterPlanned
WebPlanned
Takeaways

• Sliders should be used for making selections from a range of values
  • When interacting with a slider, changes should be reflected back to a user immediately
  • Sliders should present the full range of choices that are available to a user
What's new
• Color: New color mappings and compatibility with dynamic color

Color

Color values are implemented through design tokens. For design, this means working with color values that correspond with tokens. For implementation, a color value will be a token that references a value. Learn more about design tokens.

Configurations

Two thumbs

Sliders can have two selection handles (thumbs) for when a user needs to select a range.

contentChunks.footer: Sliders can be used to adjust a value in real time, such as image attributes.

contentChunks.htmlValue: Usage

Sliders allow users to view and select a value (or range) along a track. Theyâ€™re ideal for adjusting settings such as volume and brightness, or for applying image filters.

Sliders can use icons or labels to represent a numeric or relative scale.Â

contentChunks.footer: Example settings screen with two continuous sliders.

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Immediate effects
Changes made with sliders are immediate, allowing the user to make slider adjustments while determining a selection. Sliders shouldnâ€™t be used to adjust settings with any delay in providing user feedback.

Current state
Sliders reflect the current state of the settings they control.

There are two types of sliders:

  1. Continuous sliderÂ 
    Allows users to select a value along a subjective range.
  2. Discrete sliderÂ 
    Allows users to select a specific value from a predetermined range. Tick marks may be used to indicate available values.
Anatomy

contentChunks.footer:
1. Track
2. Tick marks (optional)
3. Handle
4. Value label (optional)

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Track

The track shows the range that is available for a user to select from. For left-to-right (LTR) languages, the smallest value appears on the far left end of the track and the largest value is on the far right. For right-to-left (RTL) languages this orientation is reversed.

Tick marks (optional)

Tick marks along a track represent predetermined values that the user can select from.Â

contentChunks.footer: Tick marks on a discrete slider.

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Handle

The handle is a position indicator that can be moved along the track, displaying the selected value of its position.

When sliders have two handles, they indicate the minimum and maximum values in a range.

Overlapping handles
The handle last moved exists on top of the second handle. The handle and label on top use a 1dp white border that is only visible when the two handles overlap.

contentChunks.footer: The most recently used handle appears on top.

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Value label (optional)

A value label displays the specific value that corresponds with the handleâ€™s placement.Â 

The label appears when the handle is selected. For range sliders, labels appear when either handle is selected.
BehaviorÂ

Sliders can be controlled by:

  1. Select and drag
  2. Select jump
  3. Select and arrow

contentChunks.footer: A single value slider with a selected handle.

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Select and drag

Select a value by dragging the handle. Â

contentChunks.footer: Discrete slider: Handle snaps to closest tick mark.

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Select jump

Select a value by selecting part of the track.Â

contentChunks.footer: Continuous slider: Handle moves to selected location.
Discrete slider: Handle snaps to closest tick mark

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Select and arrow

Select a value by keyboard navigation.

Tab: Focus lands on handle
Arrows: selected value increases or decreases

contentChunks.footer: Discrete slider: Handle snaps to next selectable value

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Accessibility guidelines coming soon

In progress: complete guidance for accessible interaction, keyboard navigation, labeling, and more. Learn more about accessibility.
